oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ovarian Responses to Treatment of Non-Lactating Cycling Holstein Cows with a Combination of Progesterone and Either GnRH or Oestradiol Benzoate, Injected at Diestrus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Segwagwe, B. V. E.
Macmillan, K. L.
Mansell, P. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: GnRH
conception rates
estrus
ovulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Treatment of cycling cows with GnRH or ODB at the time of CIDR device insertion during diestrus (day 13) caused follicular turnover and a synchronized emergence of a new follicular wave. Thisfollicular wave emerged earlier in GnRH than in ODBtreated cows. Following the synchronized emergence of a new wave, there was a synchronized onset of estrus and ovulation. The onset of estrus and ovulation were not influenced by treatment. ODB caused atresia of every second dominant follicle, while GnRH could not consistently ovulate this second dominant follicle. The inability of GnRH to consistently cause follicular turnover may be a limitation to its use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2006; 291-292
